#summary How to use templates with ejs.

= Introduction =

Templates let you load ejs files that are automatically compiled and cached.  You don't have to build template strings or insert templates in the page's html.

= Example =
{{{
var templates = new Templates()
var o1 = {animals: ['sloth', 'bear', 'monkey']};
var o2 = {animals: ['tiger', 'dog', 'elephant']};
var result1 = templates.find('templates/test.ejs').process(o1)
var result2 = templates.find('templates/test.ejs').process(o2)
}}}
